project.name: Udacity Ajax API Project
project.explanation: The project includes the ability to import photos from Unsplash using the API and Ajax, and the ability to import articles using the New York Times API. Ajax and Fetch were used to step by step, and API key was included in the header and sent to the server to learn how to get the right data and utilize it for JSON data.

project.name: Udacity Cat Clicker
project.explanation: It was a project that started with a small project and was able to solve problems that might arise as the requirements increased. The Premium version of this project is redeveloped with the MVC pattern, separating Model, View and Controller.

project.name: Udacity Cat Clicker Premium Pro
project.explanation: This project redeveloped Udacity's Cat Clicker project in the MVC pattern. For efficiency of the software, Model, View and Controller are separated. Even if a new cat is added to the model, the controller will process it and send it to the View. In addition, I created the Admin Panel section, which allows you to add elements directly to the Model.

project.name: Udacity Feed Reader Testing
project.explanation: This project has already been completed and has been able to use Jasmine to perform tests for individual functions, called TDD. The required tests for the project (RSS feed testing, RSS feed properties, menu default state, and menu hiding / showing) are all provided and adequately tested.

project.name: Scrimba React Chat App
project.explanation:
This project is a project from a training site called Scrimba. It uses React.js to open chat rooms and chat. I use Heroku's free server, so you can check the demo version via the link in Github. 

In this lesson, I learned the following parts.
Class components
Event handlers
Life-cycle methods
JSX
State and props
Inverse data flow
Functional components

project.name: Udacity Build a Portfolio Site
project.explanation: This repository is the code for the "Build a Portfolio Site" project from Udacity. This project is a project to learn HTML and CSS. Since the Github Pages feature is enabled, you can access it directly from the URL in README.md, which is included in Github. In this project, responsive design is applied and CRUD function will be included later by using Express framework and NodeJS.

project.name: Udacity Classic Arcade Game
project.explanation: This project was done to learn object-oriented programming of JavaScript. I was able to learn how to use HTML5 Canvas to manipulate the provided elements. I was wondering how to convert already written code into ES6 syntax and how to write README.md file. I modified the project so that I could pick characters to make the most of the characters already provided.

project.name: Udacity Memory Game
project.explanation: This project is focused on utilizing JavaScript. I wrote a JavaScript function and implemented a Memory game using various methods. I also learned how to manipulate the DOM using jQuery, and I got used to using some of the already implemented source code. In addition, I was able to modify it the way I want using the Dialog JavaScript library called VEX which I found online.

project.name: Engineer Information Processing
project.explanation: It is a software development certification that examines the ability to perform tasks such as planning, analysis, design, implementation, testing, operation and maintenance as a job to perform project work throughout the lifecycle of the information system .
project.sumlang: Human Resources Development Service of Korea

project.name: Network Engineer/Engineer of Network Management
project.explanation: A network administrator is a qualification for Internet-related technology that can build a server, configure a security system, optimize a system, and manage it effectively. Class 2 is nationally certified, and subjects are network general, TCP / IP, NOS, network operation equipment.

project.name: Computer operator
project.explanation: Effective use of computers requires sophisticated software as well as hardware. Therefore, in order to develop excellent programs and to improve the efficiency of the business, it is necessary to have people with expertise in computers and skills and functions, so as to foster technicians who effectively operate computer programs
project.sumlang: Korea Chamber of Commerce and Industry (KCCI)

project.name: Humanities and Social Sciences
project.explanation: This certificate was awarded to the Korea Internet Promotion Agency as a result of the completion of the [Humanities and Social Convergence Software Talent Training (2nd)] course.

project.name: Oracle Certifed Professional, Java SE Programmer
project.explanation:
Oracle's Java Programmer certification is critical to maximizing your potential and moving your Java career forward.
Over 30, 000 Java Developers per year become certified on Java.
More than 800,000 of these Java developers are using the knowledge, skills and recognition learned through Java Certifications to improve their job prospects, earn more money* and become more valuable employees. 

With 3 billion devices running Java worldwide, the world's top companies rely on experienced Java Programmers to build and maintain these critical applications.

project.name: PADI Open Water Diver
project.explanation: Open Water Diver (OWD) is an entry-level autonomous diver certification for recreational scuba diving. Although different agencies use different names, similar entry-level courses are offered by all recreational diving agencies and consist of a combination of knowledge development (theory), confined water dives (practical training) and open water dives (experience) suitable to allow the diver to dive on open circuit scuba, in open water to a limited depth and in conditions similar to those in which the diver has been trained or later gained appropriate experience, to an acceptable level of safety.

project.name: PADI Advanced Open Water Diver
project.explanation:
Advanced Open Water Diver (AOWD) is a recreational scuba diving certification level provided by several diver training agencies. Agencies offering this level of training under this title include Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI), and Scuba Schools International (SSI). Other agencies offer similar training under different titles. Advanced Open Water Diver is one step up from entry level certification as a beginner autonomous scuba diver to the ISO24901-2 standard. A major difference between Autonomous diver equivalent Open Water Diver (OWD) certification and AOWD is that the depth limit is increased from 18 to 30 metres (60 to 100 ft).

Prerequisite certification level for AOWD training is OWD or a recognized equivalent (ISO24901-2). Certification requirements for AOWD includes theory learning and assessment, practical training and assessment, and a minimum requirement for number of logged dives, that varies between agencies. SSI requires 24 logged dives.[1] PADI requires 5 dives on course, and the prerequisite is OWD which requires 4 open water dives. No additional logged dives are specified.

project.name: IoT Developer Course
project.explanation:

project.name: Udacity Front-End Web Developer Nanodegree
project.explanation: The Front End Developer Nanodegree program is composed of five projects. With each project, you'll create something that demonstrates your mastery of in-demand skills. Projects range in complexity, and each builds upon the previous. In the end, you will have a resume-worthy portfolio that you can showcase to prospective employers.

project.name: Portfolio with NodJS and Express
project.explanation: This project is a portfolio web application that implements the Create, Read, Update, and Delete functions using NodeJS, Express, and JSON management DB, LowDB.
